title: FA to check on mental state of England players following Bulgaria racism scandal
text:
Gareth Southgate and the Football Association will make checks on the mental state of the England players who suffered racist abuse in Sofia.

England players were subjected to monkey chanting during their 2020 Euro qualifying victory over Bulgaria.

Incidents were reported by Tyrone Mings, Callum Wilson, who also heard chanting during the warm-up, captain Harry Kane and Raheem Sterling. Mings insisted afterwards that the abuse did not affect his feelings and that he simply felt sorry for the racists.

The players also made a collective decision to continue the game. But it is believed that his team-mates feared that at least one of England’s players was affected by the chanting and manager Southgate and the FA will make checks on the entire squad during the next 10 days.

Players will also be supported by their clubs, but, just as they did after the racist abuse in Montenegro, Southgate and the FA will make their own checks on the squad to see whether anybody needs any additional support.
